subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Tests and Business Rules
msgSnippet: ... Indeed, this is a valid way to bind the relevant data required to assert the facts of the rules.  Think of the property set as a blackboard of information
messageBody:
Mark Derricutt wrote:

>
> I was also looking at what my code does, looking at objects from the
> current HttpSession, obviously, I won't have this at testing time, so I was
> thinking, if I construct a Hashtable, and put in the objects from the
> session (or at least, the object I use) and pass the hashtable to my rule
> to test against, things could work.
>

Indeed, this is a valid way to bind the relevant data required to assert the
facts of the rules. Think of the property set as a blackboard of information
for which the rulebase asserts facts.

Your examples are on the right track. This is probably off-topic for the list,
so perhaps we should take this off-line to a private discussion if you have more
questions.

Mike

--
